Sprite is an easy to use development enviornment for games. If you're a game developer, artist, or hobbiest, this is the tool for you. We've put hours of time into Sprite to make sure it's simple, powerful, and flexible for any type of game.

No matter if you're a hardcore C++ developer, or just an scripter, we have a language for you. You can code your core app in Obj-C and write your scripts in Lua. Or you can write your app in Ruby and use OpenGL for all your graphics. It doesn't matter. We support and have syntax hilighting for all the languages you see to the right. It gets better, we compile everything down into C code to run on any platform.

Multiple Languages

Ruby, JS, Obj-C, C++, OpenGL, & Lua

Whether you're developing for mobile or desktop, we've got you covered. Never feel like you have to put one platform before another, or spend months porting over features for the rest of your potential customers. Just write once, and ship to all.

Multiple Platforms

Windows, Mac, iOS & Android

We've built a great place to keep all your files organized. That means no more hunting for code, images, models, sounds, music, or anything else your game needs. They're easy to add and easy to get to.

Asset Management

Keep all of your files in one place

Version control is essential for building any large application. Whether it's for a team or an individual developer, we've integrated git into our application. You can push, pull, branch, and commit, right in the app.

Frequetly Asked Questions

Can I run Sprite on Windows?

Not at the moment. We have faith that Microsoft can get their act together, but for now, we can't provide a solid platform for development.

Do you have group Pricing?

Yes! If you have a team of 5 or more people, get in touch.

Do I to lisence anything to release a game with your tools?

Ncot at all. All you need to do is purchase the app and you can release whatever you want.

By Developers, For Developers

We wanted to develop games, but there wasn't anything that met our standards. Every other tool out there was clunky, ugly and a pain to use. That's why we created Sprite. Our goal is to keep you from fighting with your IDE and get you developing.
